file_content.text: Wait! Cease fire! This is a losing battle.
If you're giving up, get on with it.
Drop the weapons. All of you.
We do not submit.
You've done all you can. This is my fight to lose.
Finally dawned on you that resisting is pointless?
Now you're learning.
I had to try. Now I have to deal.
Calling it quits already?
This is a pivotal moment in this planet's history; I won't let our squabbles get in the way.
If you'll allow these Gormak to return home, I'll lay down my weapon.
I've already got you dead to rights.
You can't escape anyway.
It's a small concession. They've done enough dying for other's sake.
You're going to sacrifice yourself for perfect strangers?
Why are they so important?
No, I'm going to keep them from sacrificing themselves for something as insignificant as my life.
Anything you want can't be good for me.
You're up to something.
No tricks. We've found answers here. Important answers.
Jedi and Sith waged war here centuries ago--both manipulating these people into fighting their battles for them. It's all painted here on these walls. Now we've come full circle.
These people deserve better than to be exploited by galactic politics. Give them a fighting chance.
Couldn't care less about the Gormak.
Fine, they aren't my problem.
Sparing a couple Gormak won't change anything.
This won't affect anything.
Should that make a difference? Besides, you're wrong. These Gormak can challenge their leaders with the truths discovered here.
If the Gormak and the Voss can reconcile their differences, they could join the galaxy on their own terms instead of being used as fodder in this war.
Freedom has its price.
They'll have to pay for it.
Ah yes, money. They have nothing to offer you can't just take, except for a brighter future.
Think of what the Gormak's science and the Voss's insight could bring to the greater galaxy if they could work together.
Boss free Gormak like Blizz?
No. They die.
She's good. I even believe her... better not take any chances with her.
Aww, don't it just get you all teary-eyed? Lemme show 'er how to tear at heartstrings, literal-like.
Shouldn't be necessary.
No, we're finished with them.
Start with them. I'll make sure she doesn't miss a minute.
Be my guest.
Your call. She's going nowhere. Promise.
I have no reason to stop them.
Kill them all, to be sure.
There's no reason to turn this into a bloodbath, right?
I'll give her one chance.
Wrong.
No loose ends.
Please, let them go.
The Gormak can leave as along as they don't try anything.
You're my only interest here.
It's not my place to stand in their way.
Who am I to say no?
No, I'm pretty sure it is.
They stab you in the back, don't expect me to stand in the way.
Got a soft spot for broads? Chump.
Broads. Always stickin' together, cryin'. Gimme a break!
Second chance. Don't waste it.
You think they'll really make peace? I hope so.
Thank you.
Go, others need to know what we found here.
Bye-bye, Gormak people! Sorry we beat you up!
Do what you came to do.
I don't need your permission.
I plan to. [Freeze her]
Hold that pose.
Say cheese. [Freeze her]
Boss and Blizz leave scary place now?
Not centerpiece material, but she should do well at market.
Lemme guess, I get to carry it?
I had her pegged all wrong.
After all you put me through, I'm gonna enjoy this.
With pleasure. [Kill her]
No regrets.
It safe for Blizz to look now?
I'll never understand how these loons can value anything more than their own skin.
Heh, nice pattern.
Had conviction. Have to respect that.
Let's go please.
We're done here.
I've had enough of the water works.
Boo hoo. Shut up. [Attack]
Bloodthirsty idiot!
Sorry, Gormak-lady, boss says we beat you up.
Sorry, toots, can't please everybody all of the time.
Save your breath for the screamin', girlie.
Least you die fighting.
I hate this part.
I expected we'd cross paths again, but not here.
You've got nothing left to hide behind, General.
I've finally got you cornered.
You're keeping interesting company these days, General.
I see you're chumming around.
It's not hard to find people who share a desire for peace and prosperity. A Mandalorian wouldn't understand.
I learned a long time ago not to paint all people with the same brush, even bounty hunters.
You didn't come to this hellhole just to hide from me.
Why are you even out here?
Jokull is out of his mind. He thinks the Voss are to blame for the corruption in the Nightmare Lands, but he's wrong.
We came here looking for answers. Something to settle the differences between the Gormak and Voss. The truth.
I'm so close to getting these people on speaking terms, and you're about to throw it all away. For what, money? Tell me you're not that petty.
You can't negotiate your way out of this one.
You're wasting your breath.
My friends here long for peace, and they're willing to fight for it.
You're between me and a man spouting lies. Nothing personal.
I've got to clear my name.
I think that's a small sacrifice for peace. Nothing personal.
Call it what you want, it pays the bills.
Guess I'm petty then.
How very sad.
Show her what you're made of!
Show him what you're made of!
I apologize that the Empire has decided to waste your time today.
You won't smooth things over with a smile this time. The evidence of your guilt is plain as day.
Your holorecordings? I was really expecting you to have fabricated something a little more tangible, Ambassador.
And your only witness is a known terrorist.
You have questions. Ask.
Here I am. Talk.
You people set all that up to make me look bad.
I was framed and you know it.
Sounds familiar.
Never been convicted, but I'm not the one on trial here.
According to whom?
No, you're not, but your character is.
You're a Mandalorian. Your people have made unprovoked acts of war against the Republic and conducted genocides against entire species. Do you deny it?
Wouldn't know, I just joined.
I never did.
Mandalorians fight to better themselves; you should be flattered we even consider you a worthy opponent.
You know nothing about us.
We'd certainly rather you consider not being our opponent at all.
Only if you deny your Jedi nearly wiped the Mandalorians out before they turned on you.
People change.
I'm not here to debate history with you.
You're a bounty hunter. You kidnap and murder for anyone who is willing to pay. You're currently in the employ of the Empire, are you not?
I don't discuss privileged information.
That's confidential.
How's that any different than the price your Republic cronies put on my head?
You're a hypocrite.
Rewarding the capture of a criminal for trial is not the same as paying to have one's enemies murdered.
They've hired me to apprehend a criminal; that's why we're here.
Yes, actually.
I'm guilty of nothing other than the crimes that you two have dreamt up.
Tell us, how'd you acquire this evidence of yours?
It's here. That's all that matters.
No comment.
Over a lot of dead bodies. Your friends mostly.
It involved a bit of shooting.
Your cover story is that you murdered Republic officials?
Your subordinates provided everything I needed.
From your people.
That's... preposterous.
This is exactly why I asked to face my accusor.
I won't stand here and listen to the Empire slander me.
I think we've heard enough. It's clear my accusor has no intention of cooperating.
The Empire expects you to take the word of a hired killer, instead of a respected official who's proven her commitment to the Voss people time and again.
You will remember it is I who agreed to make the pilgrimage to the Shrine of Healing to show my solidarity with the Voss.
An idle promise! My associate can just as easily agree to make this pilgrimage.
Then take the trials, outsiders. That will reveal true character. We have concluded.
You have shown us much. Safe journeys.
Cagey, diplomatic, almost charming. Not what I expected from a mass murderer. Did you really do all those terrible things?
I don't get chummy with my bounties, General.
I have nothing to say to you.
But this is me, getting to know you.
Those charges were greatly exaggerated.
No, I didn't.
I believe you, for what it's worth.
If you're as smart as you appear, you'll call it quits. I've spent months preparing for the trials. They'll kill you. Ambassador.
Next time we meet, I'll be sure to remove any doubt.
You'll find out soon.
You and the Sith were made for each other.
It appears I've been spared. My soldiers' deaths were not in vain.
Hedging my questions was smart. A shame the ambassador had to open his mouth and seal your fate.
I've spent months preparing for the trials; they're going to kill you. Ambassador.
I may have to retain you for the Diplomatic Service.
Expect a healthy bonus. I'll be taking it out of my incompetent subordinates' pay.
You shut her up right quickly--she wasn't expecting you to handle yourself so well.
I'll requisition a little bonus for your performance. Keep it up.
Are you on her payroll now? You couldn't have supported her argument any better if you'd rehearsed it!
That went about as I expected.
You didn't budge. Well done. Never give them anything to work with.
As to this trials business, I had to show the Voss we are willing to do anything the Republic will do. You understand?
I've got it covered.
Of course. Don't sweat it.
Consider yourself lucky.
I've got it covered.
You were closer to the truth than you know.
I'm no stranger to one-upmanship, but she's the one lagging behind.
Consider yourself lucky.
I oughta dangle your sorry hide from the nastiest drop on this rock, but I guess I'll let you off easy.
I've already completed the trials.
The Voss allowed you...? That's wonderful! Return to the shrine as soon as possible. Maybe you can head General Redrish off.
I've already started the pilgrimage.
You have? What did I say about mixing with the locals? At least you've got a head start.
Have you thought this through or were you just blowing hot air?
Tell me you have a plan.
Not exactly what I'd call a victory, Ambassador.
That could have gone better.
We rushed things, but we got her to show her hand. This pilgrimage to the Shrine of Healing might be our opportunity to strike.
Ever heard the phrase "pick your battles"?
Should have thought it out.
Wait, calm down. This might be the opportunity we've been looking for!
These trials are obviously deadly; if General Redrish were not to return from her pilgrimage, it would hardly be unexpected.
I'll keep on her trail until an opportunity presents itself.
You have a point.
I'd rather kick back and wait for her to get herself killed.
It's an unnecessary risk.
No, no, no. If General Redrish is willing to take the trials, she must know how to pass them.
Completing the trials would make her revered by the Voss. She can't be allowed to succeed.
I'll make sure she has an out of body experience.
Now you're thinking.
Just make sure it happens away from prying eyes.
Well... best of luck with these trials. I'm sure you'll do fine.
Fadith-Ki is an influential figure at the pilgrim camp and is not hostile to us. See if he has any insight on getting you into this Shrine of Healing.
